title: Understanding Strings in SQL
text: In SQL, functions can perform operations on string data types, such as converting to uppercase or extracting a substring.

title: The UPPER() Function
text: The UPPER() function is used to convert all letters in a string to uppercase. It is often used to standardize text data.

title: Understanding substr() Function
text: The substr() function is used to extract a part of a string. The typical syntax is substr(column, start, length), where 'start' is the starting position and 'length' is the number of characters to extract.
